title: Ticket #773: Check for GRID_ MONITOR_ NO_ STATUS_ TIMEOUT inefficient
description:
In the gridmanager, whenever a grid monitor status report arrives, the GlobusResource object looks at all jobs for that resource and triggers the state evaluation timers of those whose LastRemoteStatusUpdate is more than GRID_MONITOR_NO_STATUS_TIMEOUT seconds in the past. When there are a large number of jobs, this takes a lot of time.

This gt2-specific check for jobs with a stale job status has been mostly superseded by a check in BaseJob, and can probably be removed. The timeout in the BaseJob check isn't configurable, which should be changed.

A quick optimization of the gt2-specific check is to not trigger a state evaluation for unsubmitted jobs (i.e. no GridJobId).
